docs.abstract: Peter McGough, of the art duo McDermott & McGough, wrote a memoir on his adventures as a queer artist who drove a Model T.
docs.snippet: Peter McGough, of the art duo McDermott & McGough, wrote a memoir on his adventures as a queer artist who drove a Model T.
docs.lead_paragraph: Once in the late 1970s, somebody insulted David McDermott’s mother at a party, so he went to Tiffany & Company and had a note engraved: “Mr. David Walter McDermott is pleased to announce the elimination of _______ from his guest list.”

headline.main: They Were Victorian Dandies Who Made Art. Now They’re On the Outs.

docs.abstract: Andrea Masenda, who met Kevin Lo when both were working at ESPN, wasn’t sure she was on a first date, or even if she wanted to be. Mr. Lo had no such doubt.
docs.snippet: Andrea Masenda, who met Kevin Lo when both were working at ESPN, wasn’t sure she was on a first date, or even if she wanted to be. Mr. Lo had no such doubt.
docs.lead_paragraph: Andrea Masenda sat across from Kevin Lo at a Chili’s restaurant in Bristol, Conn., wondering all the while if she was on a first date.

headline.main: Adding a Wedding to the Highlight Reel
headline.print_headline: Adding a Wedding to the Highlight Reel

docs.abstract: Full-time union hotel workers are watching app-based services replace them. Who’s next?
docs.snippet: Full-time union hotel workers are watching app-based services replace them. Who’s next?
docs.lead_paragraph: A few years ago, Adalberto Martín began to see some troubling changes at work. As a veteran member of the room service staff at Marriott’s W Hotel in downtown San Francisco, he was an expert in delivering carefully assembled trays of food and drink to hungry guests. But the number of orders had sharply decreased. What was once 50 glasses of orange juice every morning had dwindled to 10, and Mr. Martín’s tip income fell accordingly. At lunchtime, he seemed to make more deliveries of plates and silverware than actual food.

headline.main: The Gig Economy Is Coming for Your Job
headline.print_headline: The Apps Are Coming for You

docs.abstract: About 40 million people were at risk of severe thunderstorms or tornadoes, from Texas to Tennessee. To the north, rain, flooding and ice were all in the forecast.
docs.snippet: About 40 million people were at risk of severe thunderstorms or tornadoes, from Texas to Tennessee. To the north, rain, flooding and ice were all in the forecast.
docs.lead_paragraph: A rash of thunderstorms and tornadoes. The threat of snow and ice. Even unusually warm temperatures in some places.

headline.main: Winter Storm Threatens Much of the U.S. With Tornadoes, Flooding and Ice

docs.abstract: A motorcycle accident brings together four lives that had been kept intentionally separate.
docs.snippet: A motorcycle accident brings together four lives that had been kept intentionally separate.
docs.lead_paragraph: “I want to see the body,” said my 12-year-old son, Miles.

headline.main: Two Open Marriages in One Small Room
headline.print_headline: Two Open Marriages in One Small Room

docs.abstract: Teenagers and young men still don’t have the right vocabulary. Can we help them get there?
docs.snippet: Teenagers and young men still don’t have the right vocabulary. Can we help them get there?
docs.lead_paragraph: A while back, during a discussion I was having with a group of high school students about sexual ethics, a boy raised his hand to ask me, “Can you have sex without feelings?” The other guys in the room nodded, leaned forward, curious, maybe a little challenging. Strictly speaking, of course, even indifference is a feeling, but I knew what they meant: They wanted to know if they could have sex without caring: devoid of vulnerability, even with disregard for a partner. To put it in teenage parlance, they wanted to know whether it was truly possible to “hit it and quit it.”

headline.main: Will We Ever Figure Out How to Talk to Boys About Sex?
headline.print_headline: Will We Ever Learn How to Talk About Sex?
